page.title: 09WILDLIFE IN THE SAMPFORDS
page.content: Sampford is a good place for rare wild flowers.One hundred and twenty seven wild flowers have been seen here.The rarest of these are the Bee Orchids and the Butterfly Orchid.The most common flower is the Sheeps Parsley. Last month wild Yellow Irises were in bloom on the pond.Also several stems of delicate Ragged Robin were found in the damper parts of the wood.Alot of butterflies have been seen around The Sampfords too.They include The Gatekeeper,Ringlet,Red Admiral and the Small Heath.Unfortunatly it has been a cold year for flowers.This has had a bad effect on the bees in The Sampfords with many local beekeepers losing their hives.While at school we have had three separate swarms attracted to our chimney in the first few days of July when the weather suddenly turned hot.
